DOC.brief_title: The Vegetable Dose Response Study : Effects Consumption Inflammation Oxidative Stress
DOC.detailed_description: Women randomly assign vegetable feeding dose order consume 2,5 & 10 servings/day vegetable 3 week period , feed period separate 4 week washout period , time limited number low biological value fruit vegetable eaten . This research provide important relevant information fill several gap current knowledge include thorough description oxidant stress inflammatory status overweight , postmenopausal woman , assessment relevant daily `` dose '' vegetable necessary modulate biomarkers oxidant stress inflammation overweight postmenopausal woman evaluation association plasma nutrient carotenoid level relation change oxidant stress inflammation population . Our long-term goal reduce chronic disease risk among `` at-risk '' post-menopausal female .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Female ; 2 . Age 50 75 year age ; 3 . Target include 20 % minority subject . 4 . Postmenopausal define great 12 month without menses ; lab value indicative postmenopausal status ; 5 . Waist hip ratio > 0.85 ; 6 . Body mass index ( BMI ) 25.0 45 kg/m2 ; 7 . Nonsmoker ; 8 . Reported alcohol intake < 2 serving daily ; 9 . Reported stable body weight previous 6 month ; 10 . In general good health history cancer ( non melanoma skin cancer ) , diabetes , liver renal disease ; 11 . No known allergy intolerance leaf lettuce , tomato , carrots pepper ; 12 . Willing able successfully complete runin activity 1 . Morbid obesity ( BMI > 45 kg/m2 ) ; 2 . Medical diagnosis require therapeutic diet ( i.e , diabetes , hepatic disease , etc ) ; 3 . Smoking history within previous 6 month ; 4 . Consuming > 5 serving fruits/vegetables daily prior study enrollment ; 5 . Regular use antiinflammatory medication ; 6 . Unwilling discontinue dietary supplement exception study provide multivitamin and/or calcium supplement ; 7 . Unwilling adhere study protocol include limit fruit intake 1 serve per day exclude vegetable intake study provide allow vegetable . 8 . Participating great 10 hour regularly schedule physical activity weekly participate vigorous physical activity regular basis ( i.e . daily running , contact sport , etc ) assess use validated physical activity assessment questionnaire .
